Apple__Apple_scab.treatment: Apply fungicides containing myclobutanil or captan; remove infected leaves.
Apple__Apple_scab.prevention: Plant resistant varieties; remove fallen leaves; prune trees to improve airflow.
Apple__Apple_scab.notes: Dark olive-green lesions appear on leaves and fruit.

Apple___Black_rot.treatment: Remove and destroy infected branches; apply fungicides.
Apple___Black_rot.prevention: Prune for airflow; rotate with non-host crops.
Apple___Black_rot.notes: Fruit develops black, rotting spots with concentric rings.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.treatment: Apply copper-based fungicides during infection periods.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.prevention: Plant resistant varieties; remove nearby junipers.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.notes: Orange or yellow spots on leaves; alternate host required.

Apple___healthy.prevention: Maintain regular monitoring and good orchard management.

Blueberry___healthy.prevention: Ensure proper soil pH and watering.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.treatment: Apply fungicides like sulfur; remove infected leaves.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.prevention: Prune for airflow; avoid overhead irrigation.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.notes: White powdery growth appears on leaves and stems.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.prevention: Maintain proper nutrition and monitor for pests.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.notes: Rectangular lesions appear along leaf veins.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.treatment: Use fungicides if severe; remove debris.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.notes: Red-brown pustules appear on leaf surfaces.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.prevention: Maintain crop rotation and monitor field.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.treatment: Apply foliar fungicides at early infection.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.notes: Elongated gray-green lesions form on leaves.

Grape___Black_rot.treatment: Apply fungicides; remove infected leaves and mummies.
Grape___Black_rot.prevention: Prune for airflow; remove fallen debris.
Grape___Black_rot.notes: Black spots appear on leaves, stems, and fruit.

Grape___healthy.prevention: Maintain proper canopy management and monitoring.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).treatment: Remove infected trees; control psyllid vectors.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).notes: Yellow shoots and misshapen fruit; spreads quickly.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper-based sprays; remove infected leaves.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Avoid overhead watering; prune for airflow.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.notes: Small water-soaked spots appear on leaves and fruit.

Peach___healthy.prevention: Maintain soil nutrition and monitor regularly.

Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper-based bactericides; remove heavily infected leaves.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use pathogen-free seeds; avoid overhead irrigation; rotate crops.
Pepper__bell___Bacterial_spot.notes: Bacteria survive in debris and seeds.

Pepper__bell___healthy.prevention: Monitor for pests and maintain soil moisture.

Potato___Early_blight.treatment: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
Potato___Early_blight.prevention: Plant resistant cultivars; rotate crops every 3 years.
Potato___Early_blight.notes: Dark concentric rings appear on older leaves.

Potato___Late_blight.treatment: Use systemic fungicides; remove infected plants.
Potato___Late_blight.prevention: Use certified tubers; avoid overhead watering.
Potato___Late_blight.notes: Highly aggressive; spreads in cool, wet weather.

Potato___healthy.prevention: Monitor for pests; maintain standard practices.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.treatment: Remove infected leaves; apply fungicides if severe.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.prevention: Avoid overhead irrigation; use disease-free plants.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.treatment: Apply copper sprays; remove infected foliage.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use certified seeds; avoid wet conditions.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.notes: Small water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit.

Tomato___Early_blight.notes: Starts on older leaves near the ground.

Tomato___Late_blight.treatment: Apply copper fungicides; remove infected plants immediately.
Tomato___Late_blight.prevention: Avoid overhead watering; ensure well-drained soil.
Tomato___Late_blight.notes: Rapidly destroys tomato plants under humid conditions.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.prevention: Keep humidity below 85%; avoid dense planting.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.notes: Olive-green velvety mold on undersides of leaves.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.treatment: Apply fungicides; avoid working with wet foliage.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Remove debris; use mulch; rotate crops.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.notes: Grey spots with tiny black specks appear on leaves.

Tomato___Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider.treatment: Apply insecticidal soap or neem oil; blast leaves with water.
Tomato___Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider.prevention: Encourage natural predators; keep plants hydrated.
Tomato___Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider.notes: Tiny yellow stippling and fine silk webbing visible.

Tomato___Target_Spot.notes: Target-like spots often confused with Early Blight.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.treatment: No cure; remove infected plants; control whiteflies.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.treatment: No cure; remove infected plants; sanitize tools.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.prevention: Use virus-free seed; avoid tobacco contamination.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.notes: Mottled green and yellow leaf pattern.
